title: Usain Bolt dons German Lederhosen as he poses with fans at Munich Beer Festival
text:

Usain Bolt dons German lederhosen – along with not-so-traditional trainers – after dashing along to the Munich Beer Festival.

The legendary sprinter had to lower the outfit’s braces in order to adopt his celebrated “lightning bolt” pose.

But once they were back in place, the former Olympic gold medallist and world champion showed he’s still as fast as ever by quickly grabbing a foaming stein.

The Jamaican, 33, beamed with delight as he posed for selfies with other beer-lovers at the Oktoberfest gathering.

(Image: Splash News)

Recently, Jamaican sprinter Johan Blake, who used to train with Bolt, took a dim view of him criticising Jamaica’s current crop of sprinters.

The legend was quoted as saying: “When I was around I think the motivation was there and we worked hard and the level was high.

(Image: Getty)

“But now that I have left the sport, I feel like it has dropped.”

Blake said: “I remember those quotes. He said something particular which I lost all respect for him.”

(Image: Getty)

However, Bolt had more favourable words for Manchester City footballer Raheem Sterling, after the Manchester United fan picked up the phone to congratulate fellow Jamaican-born Sterling when Manchester City beat Liverpool in the race for the Premier League title earlier this year.

Bolt told TheSportsman.com: “Listen that’s the only time I cheered for City.

"I was so happy, I called Raheem (Sterling) and I was like well done bloke!”
description: The Olympic world champion, nine-times Olympic gold medalist and sprinting legend wore a pair of not-so-traditional trainers with the outfit as he showed off his signature pose
